DIV1.HEAD: VI. TEXTS OF THE MIDDLE ENGLISH EVANGELIE

HEADNOTE.P: N. B. In printing the texts, I number the lines after D, as far as it goes. The lines of B are restored to coup∣let form. The punctuation is that of the MSS., except the hyphens. The capitalization is that of the MSS. Where a small letter stands in D as a guide for the illuminator, it is printed in parentheses; where the small letter is lack∣ing, the initial is supplied in brackets.

DIV2.HEAD: DULWICH COLL. MS. XXII

LG.L: [S]Um wyle i was wyt sinne ibunde
Ant sinne me hauid cast to grunde
Bot swete ih̄u þine fif wundis.
Lesid me hauis of harde stundis.
Se hu i to þe wende mi þouht.
Pynis to þole greuis me nouht.
þi ded me hauis of serue al brouht.
Ant loue to þe in me hauis wrouht.
þe to loue is al mi blisse.
Me longyt sore þin wndis kisse
Swete ih̄u mi þot þou wisse{punctel}
þe to loue þat i ne MS., ine as one word. misse.
Do me MS., Dome as one word. ih̄u aftir þi name.
þat þou me schilde from sinne ant schame.

DIV2.P: ih̄u ih̄u propter hoc nomen/ tuum Fac michi secundum hoc nomen/ tuum. nomen dulce. nomen delectabile. nomen/ con∣fortans peccatorem ihu saluator propter temet ipsum/ esto/ in ih̄c ne peream./

LG.L: [F]Ole þoutis me were inwnid to tille
Fele sithis to don ille.
In word. in dede. in wikke wille.
Nicht ant day al me to spille.
[B]ot wan MS., two letters erased after wan; hu(?) faintly legible. þat i me MS., ime as one word. vndir-stod.
þat þou for me scheddist þi blod.
Folye to lete me þouhte god.
Ant to þe ih̄u torne mi mod.

DIV2.P: i. petri. quia aduersarius noster diabolus/ circumit querens quem deuoret. [I Peter v, 8]

LG.L: [B]Ote þat i me bi-gan to drede.
þat he þat man eggiz to quede.
Wyt sum fol þot me scholde lede.
To wicke wille. or folye dede.
(f)or-þi mi þouht on þe i feste.
For þare i wot MS., iwot as one word. to finde reste.
Of eche loue þou art þe beste.
þou art þe loue þat eye wele leste.
Ne is name ih̄u non bote in þe.
In wahm bi-houiz vs bore∣wid be.
(þ)i loue to winne i wolde fonde.
ȝif y me mouhte wel undir∣stonde
Sum þng of þe write ant MS., t above the line. rede
þare þoureu of þe to winne mede
(a)nt þei þat hit schal here.
Of þe godspelle may sum þing lere.
þat writin is þare-inne of þe.
On english tunge þoreu swink of me.
(w)ise men in olde dawis.
Bokis made of gode lawis.
Hu men þem scholde wit rihte MS., ritte, with h above. lede.
Ant wis to be in al þere dede.
(a)nt þei no þing. ne wiste of þe
Bote godis þeym of ston ant tre.
Ant þing þat ne mouhte se ne here
For god honuride ant hit held dere
(s)unne ant mone. day and niht
FFire ant al þat giuiz liht.
þat godis were alle þei wende
Ant þei o MS., þe deleted by line, with o above. god no þing ne kende

DIV2.P: actus iiii. Neque enim est nomen aliud sub/ celo. in quibus oporteat nos sal∣uari quam ih̄c./ [Acts IV, 12]
Sapientia xiii. de hiis que videntur bona non cognouerunt quis esset ar∣tifex. citatum aerem aut girvm/ stellarum aut so∣lem aut luna[m] puta∣uerunt deos./ [Sap. xiii, 1, 2]

LG.L: (o)f grete clerkis alswo we finde. ,
þat bokis made of bestis kinde.
Of foulh of ston. of gres of tre.
Ant al for man þere-on to se.
Solas to haue ant tech∣inge{punctel}
Ofte him to holde fra fol likinge.
(w)oh swo heriz of bestis kinde.
He may þare mani wundir finde.
Fele þingis here ant se Read "se ant here," for rhyme.
Ware-þoru he may him seluin lere.
His lif to lede wit more winne.
God to do ant leue sinne
(f)or a wis man seiz þat bestis be.
Hert ant neddre. ant ern{punctel} þis þre.
þat changiz þere lif þoruut þere kin/de.
For þus of hem iwrite we finde.
(þ)e hert{punctel} wehn him ney∣hiz elde.
þat he ne may him seluin welde.
Seke Infinitive. a neddre kun ? kunde. him wl teche.
Ant him to swolwe in∣stede A hyphen before the second part of a compound word indicates a hyphen in the MS. of leche.

DIV2.P: Ysydorus ceruus inquid cum senuerit{punctel}/ serpentem deuorat & fonte[m] ad pecit qua/ hausta. incal∣escit & proicit onica & pilos veteres & sic post modicum iuuenescit & leuis/ sit qui se ante iu∣uare non poterat./

LG.L: (a)nt aftir þat wile he nouht duelle.
Til þat he finde watir of welle.
Ant with gret hete faste swinke.
Til þat he of þat watir drinke
(w)en he his hot an for∣swnkin.
Ant of þat welle hauiz drunkin.
His olde clos. ant his olde her.
Ant al pat was hold on him er.
Awei he castiz on wndir wise.
Ant newe bi-ginniz to springe MS., in written above the line. ant rise.
Ant he bi-comiz al ȝung ant lith{punctel}
þat helpe him muhte bi∣fore nowiht.
(þ)e holde hert is man in sinne.
þat longe hauiz ileyn þar∣inne.
þat so schal þe neddre swolue.
For hise sinnis haue sik ant sorewe
Ant inewardly wit muht him schriue
Of al þat he hauis don in liue.
Ant drinke of þe welle þat ran on blode
Wehn swete ih̄u was don on rode.
(o)f ih̄u þat is þe side.
For man þat was istungin wide.
Ant þouru þat drink he schal biginne
A new lif and leue sinne
Dauid MS., d written at the left of the line for insertion. þe king of þis drinkinge.
In his sauter þan makis muninge
Alse þe hert he seiz ne wil nouht dwel[le]
þat ȝerniz watir of þe welle.
Aswo ? alswo. þe soule þat is in me.
Hauiz ȝerning iesu to þe.

DIV2.P: Sicut ceruus fontes aquarum ita desiderat/ anima mea ad te deus [Ps. xli, 2] & in ysaya xii./ Haurite aquas in gaudio de fonti/bus salu∣atoris/ [Is. xii, 3]

LG.L: (þ)e neddre vehn he is hold bi-comin.
þat his mihte is him bi∣nomin.
Ant hard an streit . . . The stain here in the MS. renders three letters illegible; possibly mad. is his hide.
þat he ne may on herþe glide{punctel}
He sekis ouiral a-non
Til þat he finde a þirlid ston.
(a)nt þoru þat he crepiz ofte.
Til þat his hide bicome al softe. ,
Ant til þat he a-wey al caste.
His olde skin þat him bond faste.
Ant newe bi-ginnis vp to rise.
Ant ȝung bi-comiz vp-on þis wise.
[þ]E skin þat þe neddre is bundin inne
Is old liking of mannis sinne
þat lettis man wel for to spede.
In eni god werc or eni god dede.
[F]or-þi man bundin wyt sinne.
þat wile a neu lif bi-ginne.
Wel he may forbisine take.
Of þe neddre ant of þe snake.
Ant seke þe ston til he finde
Of wihlc þe apostil paul maz minde.
þat is þe ston þat we may se.
þirlid on þe rode tre.

DIV2.P: petra autem erat xp̄c. cor. x./ [I Cor. x, 4]

LG.L: [Þ]e sinful schal þoreu þo þirlis crepe.
And so is olde s[i]nnis wepe.
And sore for hise dedis rewe.
Ant so bi-ginne his lif al newe.

DIV2.P: aquila ut dicit philoso∣phus libro de animalibus & etiam in glossa super/ psalmo dicitur senio gra∣uatur crescente rostro ut/ possit cibum capere{punctel} sed inde languescit. Sed/ na∣turali modo colidit ros∣trum collidit rostrum/ ad petram & excuti[t] rostri honus quo cibus impe/|diebatur & redit ad cibum & omnia reperiebuntur/ ut ut fiat/ iuue/ nis./

LG.L: (þ)E erne wehn is with eld of gon.
þat scho ne may mete take non.
Hire bile bi-ginnis hard to clinge.
þat scho ne mai liue wit no likinge.
Agenis a ston scho brekis hire bile.
þoureu kinde ant þoreu non oþir skille.
Ant þat er was old ant of vn-mihte.
þan may scho ete ant take hire flihte.
(o)f best of fuhl. man schal ta ȝeme.
And hise dedis alle deme.
þat he in him no þing ne finde.
þat be wrout agenis his kinde.

DIV2.P: boecius libro consola∣tionis dicit quod omni ho∣mini naturaliter in serta/ est boni/ cupiditas./ [BK. III, Prose ii]

LG.L: (a)nt a wis man vs dos to wite.
Alse we of him finde iwrite.
þat kinde giuez il man eginge.
Of god þing to haue ȝer∣ninge.
(b)ot betir þing mai no man finde.
þan þe louerd of alle kinde.
þat best ant fouhl ant alle þinge dihte.
To be vndir mannis mihte.
In holi writ þus we lere.
Wen adam was mad and heue his fere.
God þeim bad waxe ant þriue.
Ant gildre gete ant bringe to liue.
Ant fisch ant foul a best ant tre.
Ant al þat scholde on erthe be.
On lift. on watir ant on londe.
Al made god buth sinn to þeire honde.

DIV2.P: gen. i. crescite & multi∣plicamini & domi/ namini piscibus maris & uolatili∣bus celi/ & bestuis terre. & cetera./ [Gen. i, 28]

LG.L: (f) orbisine ob ? of. bestis man þou mai here.
þat þou may þe betere lere.
Ant skil in þin herte finde
þe louerd to loue of alle kinde.
Ant do al scho þe ern þe wile teche.
Ant kest a-wei þi fule speche
Ant loue god wit al þi skile
Ant swo þou brekist þin olde bile.
On þe ston þat is godis sone.
Wehn þu leuist þin old wne.
Ant þanne þou mai þi soule lithte. ,
Of god to speke and haue in-sihte
[þ]are-fore of him y write þouthe.
þat kinde in alle þingis wroute.
And us from ded to liue broute.
Wehn he us on þe rode bouhte.
[F]or ne his þinge writin in þis liue.
þat swo wel may ne swo bliue.
Mannis herte of sworue bringe
Alse haue in ih̄u al his likinge.
[F]or-þi ih̄u þi luue to winne.
þou giue me grace to bi∣ginne. MS., in written above the line.
Loue to sende to for-do sinne{punctel}
Wat al mankinde was bundin inne.

DIV2.P: primo Io[han]nis scitis quia xc apparuit ut pec∣cata/ tolleret [I John iii, 5] & iiii. in hoc est caritas dei in nos quia misit/ filium suum propiciaci∣onem pro peccatis nos∣tris./ [I John iv, 10]

LG.L: [E]r godis sune in þe maydin lihte.
Agenis þe deuil hauide we MS., we written above the line. no rihte.
For wihl we were vndir his mihte{punctel}
Of god to do we lesid sihte.
[þ]at time was sinne so rif.
In old in ȝung. in man in wif.
þat sone so MS., so written above the line. þei lefte þe lif.
To helle bi-houid wit∣houutin strif.
[H]abraham. ysaac. ant sen jon.
Dauit þe king. ant sala∣mon.
þider þei wente euirlkon.
Hauide þei þanne non oþir won.
[T]il godis sone was don on rode
þider wente wikke ant gode
þe wikke to pine wiht dreri mode.
þare to be þe deuilis fode.

þar her on liuis sinnis lete.

LG.L: (þ)e prophe[te] ysaye.
Iwnid was MS., was written above the line. to gode þus crie.
Wi ne MS., wine written as one word. woldis-tu þe heuene riue{punctel}

Of god to se þe to-cuminge

Godis to-come for to se.
Seint austin seiz þat in þo dawis.
þe holi men of þe olde lawis.
Ofte seide in þere preiere.
Weher þat chil schal finde vs here{punctel}

LG.L: (w)en god of heuene herde þis cri.
Of mankin hauede he merci.

In soule clene ant in bodi.

LG.L: Til hire he sende a swete fere.
þat him was swiþe lef ant dere. ,
Gabriel wiht swete chere.
þat hire gan grete on þis manere.

LG.L: [H]el ful of grace god is wyt þe.
Among wimman blessid þou be.
þe maidin dred on him to se.
Ant þouhte hu þis mihte be.

LG.L: [þ]anne þe aungil him spak fre.

ih̄u schal is name be.

[þ]e child þat of þe schal be borin.

þat folk he schal þat was bi-forin.

LG.L: Ant þat þou þe sothe lere.
þi nece elizabeth lo here.
þat is in eld fele ȝere.
Child nou hauis takin of hire fere.

LG.L: (þ)e sixth monith nu is anon.

For to god of heuene þat is on{punctel}
Ne is word of vn-mihte non

LG.L: Ne wolde marie no len∣gire plaide.
Bote þis wrd on hire herte leyde.

With me be don als tu saide.

LG.L: Sone so þis was in hire þout.
In hire was mannis kinde wrouht.

Man þare-offe ne drede þou nouht.

LG.L: (a)ls þe sunne þirlis þe glas.

þe sune in þe maidin lithe
þe fadir his sone in þe maydin sende

Ant alse þat swete MS., te written above the line. maidin þouhte. MS., h written above the o.

LG.L: þe angil marie god bi∣kende. ,

cam to þe hus of zakarie.

LG.L: Þer þan was a swete met∣inge. MS., metīgie; i deleted by dot.
A swete cuple a swete MS., aswete as one word. kissinge.
A maide bar god of alle þinge.
A wif seint jon in holi wendingge.
Iwrite on þis steide i finde.
þar a wis man here-of mas minde.
þat þe joie in þis met∣ingge.
þat seint jon made was biginge.
Bi-fore god go Infinitive. ant preche

LG.L: (þ)anne þankid marie god ful of blisse

Ant sende his sone in swetenesse.

LG.L: (þ)are-fore me schal al mankinde.
Blisful telle in þeire minde.
þat he wold in me swo gret þing finde

DIV2.P: ecce enim ex hoc beatam me dicent omnes genera∣tiones. quia/ &c./ [Luke i, 48-49]

LG.L: (o)f mercy þanne he was leche.
Fram kin to kinde. þat dredde his speche

And dide þe meke on hey to reche.

þe child{punctel} þat þei abide longe.

To abraham{punctel} ant his o[f]∣spring
